alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 01 at 2:03AM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except with 1 to 3 feet over the higher terrain above 3500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills, including portions of highway 138. Eastern Jackson County, including Butte Falls and Prospect. Highways 62 north of Prospect, 140 near the Cascades foothills, and 227 north of Trail. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
